meanings.sent1: She barged through the crowd to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent2: The elephant barged through the bushes in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The cat barged into the room, knocking over a vase in its haste.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds barged across the sky, blocking out the sun.
meanings.sent5: The bulldozer barged through the old building, demolishing it in seconds.

meanings.definition: A large flat-bottomed boat for carrying goods
meanings.sent1: The barge floated peacefully down the river, loaded with cargo.
meanings.sent2: The workers unloaded the goods from the barge onto the dock.
meanings.sent3: The barge looked like a giant floating box on the water.
meanings.sent4: The barge was so heavy with goods that it almost touched the waterline.
meanings.sent5: The barge slowly made its way through the canal, transporting supplies to the town.

meanings.sent1: He barged into the meeting without knocking, startling everyone inside.
meanings.sent2: The dog barged into the room, chasing after a squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel barged into the bird feeder, causing chaos among the birds.
meanings.sent4: The loud music barged into the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected noise barged into her thoughts, disrupting her concentration.
